Description of incident: Hanover Foods Inc, who is a Paytime client has learned that over 5,800 of it's employees were part of the over 216,000 individuals affected by the Paytime breach. Hanover's representing law firm has also sent a letter to those affected and has reported the incident to those individuals affected.The information breached included names, Social Security numbers, direct deposit bank account information, dates of birth, hire dates, wage information, home and cell phone numbers, and other payroll information when hackers obtained usernames and passwords associated with the Paytime system.
